value.name: One year after George Floyd murder, NYC demands: ‘Jail killer cops! Defund the police!’
value.description: On May 25, thousands of protesters took to the streets of New York City to commemorate the one year anniversary of the murder of George Floyd at the hands of Minneapolis police. Beginning as a rally of a few hundred across the street from Brooklyn’s Barclays Center,

value.name: Thousands Of New Yorkers Mark One-Year Anniversary Of George Floyd's Death
value.description: Marches, rallies, and vigils around the city paid tribute to Floyd and demanded an end to systemic racism in American law enforcement, including the NYPD.

value.name: How New Yorkers Marked the Anniversary of George Floyd’s Killing
value.description: Demonstrations across the city took on varied tones throughout the day, a mix of frustration, celebration and sadness.

value.name: Split-Second Decisions: How a Supreme Court Case Shaped Modern Policing
value.description: In 2018, the police raced to a street corner in the Crown Heights section of Brooklyn to investigate reports of a possible gunman, and moments later shot and killed Saheed Vassell, a 34-year-old mentally ill Black man who was well known around the ...

value.name: Americans Gathered to Mark Anniversary of George Floyd’s Death
value.description: Among those scheduled to speak were Eric Cassell, the father of Saheed Vassell, who was killed by the police in 2018, and Hawa Bah, the mother of Mohamed Bah, who was fatally shot by officers in Harlem in 2012. Ms. Cyril said her mother and father were ...

value.name: Police: Brooklyn Suspect Told To 'Drop It' 3 Times
value.description: NYPD officials are now saying there was a 15-second delay and three attempts to order Saheed Vassell to drop what he was holding. CBS2's Valerie Castro reports.

value.description: Saheed Vassell, and many, many others. Police brutality doesn’t take a break for pandemics. Black and Latino communities have not only suffered because our state and city governments failed to prepare for the disproportionate impact of COVID-19.
